doc.previous: Hijackings for hostages commonly produce an armed standoff during a period of negotiation between hijackers and authorities followed by some form of settlement Settlements do not always meet the hijackers original demands If the hijackers demands are deemed too great and the perpetrators show no inclination to surrender authorities sometimes employ armed special forces to attempt a rescue of the hostages notably Operation Entebbe
